alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 12:50AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska and southeast Wyoming, including the following areas, in panhandle Nebraska, Banner County, Kimball County and Scotts Bluff County. In southeast Wyoming, Central Laramie County, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, East Laramie County, East Platte County, Goshen County, Laramie Valley, North Laramie Range, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall from slow moving and training thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood The Flash Flood Watch will expire for portions of panhandle Nebraska and southeast Wyoming, including the following areas, in panhandle Nebraska, Banner County, Kimball County and Scotts Bluff County. In southeast Wyoming, Central Laramie County, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, East Laramie County, East Platte County, Goshen County, Laramie Valley, North Laramie Range, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. The flash flooding threat has ended. Therefore, the Flash Flood Watch will expire at Midnight MDT tonight.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
